span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-size: xx-large; color: black;

div.span: **Report Cards Posted to the Parent Portal - 4/7/20**

em.a: Directions - Home Instructional Plan Material - Click Here

span.strong: This is an important message from Al Harper, Superintendent of the Elmont School District. Please be advised that all schools in New York State will be closed until at least May 15, 2020, at the direction of Governor Cuomo.

strong.a: Parent Letter from Sup't. Al Harper - Update - 4/7/20
Parent Letter from Sup't. Al Harper - Update - 4/2/20

span.a: Opting Back-in To Getting Mass Notification Calls

strong.a: Letter from Sup't. Al Harper to Parents - Coronavirus Protocol - Updated - 3/6/2020

br.span: Altice (formerly Cablevision) offers a free internet product for students with no Internet access at home. Installation charges are also waived. The relationship is directly between parent/guardian and Altice so the school districts and BOCES are not involved except to provide information. Parents call 1-866-200-9522 to enroll

p.span: When a parent calls in, they can say they are calling about the offer for free internet service.

br.span: No documentation is required – just self-identification that they have a K-12 or college student in the household and do not currently have internet access at home.
There is no install fee or out of pocket costs for 60 days (as of now)

strong.a: Launch of Elmont Facebook Page and Mobile App
